docs.snippet: Since 1935, a polling organization has asked Americans the same question. This chart shows the answers they gave this month. What do you think the question is?...

docs.snippet: Germany's Thyssenkrupp has looked at the option of splitting its European steel business into a separate company that could be floated if a merger with Tata Steel assets fails, German weekly WirtschftsWoche reported on Friday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Germany's Thyssenkrupp has looked at the option of splitting its European steel business into a separate company that could be floated if a merger with Tata Steel assets fails, German weekly WirtschftsWoche reported on Friday.

headline.main: Thyssenkrupp Eyes Plan B for European Steel-Report
headline.print_headline: Thyssenkrupp Eyes Plan B for European Steel-Report

docs.snippet: Turkish leaders condemned Germany on Friday for cancelling rallies of Turkish residents due to be addressed by Ankara's ministers and accused Berlin of giving "shelter" to Turkey's enemies....
docs.lead_paragraph: Turkish leaders condemned Germany on Friday for cancelling rallies of Turkish residents due to be addressed by Ankara's ministers and accused Berlin of giving "shelter" to Turkey's enemies.

headline.main: Turkey Accuses Germany of Aiding Its Enemies, as Row Escalates

docs.snippet: China's interest rates will be decided by market forces, and the  rates are generally very stable, Yi Gang, a vice central bank governor, said on Friday....

headline.main: China Central Bank-Fluctuation in Interest Rates to Be Decided by Market Forces

docs.snippet: WPP, the world's largest advertising group, cut its 2017 sales forecasts on Friday and its shares tumbled as a tough economic environment forced rivals and clients to fight over every dollar of marketing budgets....

headline.main: WPP Says Ultra Competitive Ad Market to Hit 2017 Growth

docs.snippet: Democratic Republic of Congo's main opposition coalition said it had named the son of its late leader Etienne Tshisekedi to succeed him on Thursday, but some within the opposition rejected the choice....

docs.snippet: Brendon O'Donnell voted to leave the European Union because he felt British money should go to struggling communities or local hospitals rather than Brussels, and his voice was not being heard....

docs.snippet: The United States carried out a second day of air strikes against al Qaeda in Yemen on Friday, U.S. officials said, in the latest sign of increasing U.S. military focus on a group whose strength  has grown during Yemen's civil war....
